content: chattanooga yarncrafters page # 6 circular yoke body with cc co 48 sts and work 2 row k1p1 ribbing row 3 k4 kfb k7 x5 kfb k3 54 sts row 4 with mc p across join to work in the round round 1 alternate cc and mc around break cc and continue with mc knit 20 rounds round 22 bobble 2 sts k25 bobble 2 k to end break yarn cut a 12 /30cm piece of waste yarn and move stitches to waste yarn when you bind off the first two stitches you will have worked three stitches leaving one on the needle knitting the next 25 sts makes 26 on the needle and then when you bind off the next two stitches you are back to 25 in the first section sleeves make 2 with cc co 20 sts and work 2 row k1p1 ribbing row 3 kfb k1 kfb knit to end 22 sts row 4 with mc p across join to work in the round round 1 alternate cc and mc around break cc and continue with mc knit 2 rounds round 4 bobble two k to end 20 sts first sleeve break yarn leaving a tail for seaming the underarm gap later cut a 6 /15cm piece of waste yarn and move stitches of first sleeve to waste yarn leave second sleeve on needles join sleeves and yoke transfer 25 sts from body to needle with the working yarn connected to the first sleeve knit across these body stitches transfer remaining sleeve to needles and knit around the sleeve transfer the remaining 25 body stitches to needle and knit across then knit around the first sleeve 90 sts knit one round in mc knit one round alternating mc and cc knit one round mc yoke shaping with cc k3 k2tog around 72 sts knit one round alternating mc and cc knit one round cc with mc k2 k2tog around 54 sts knit one round alternating mc and cc break cc continue with mc and knit one round next round k1 k2tog around 36 sts knit 2 rounds k4 k2tog k2 around 28 sts turtleneck collar and finishing work 12 rounds k1p1 rib bobble seam holes at underarms closed you can use the waste yarn to seam the underarm where there is no tail weave in ends and block turn collar over sweater flight 1 by ouisi hamilton for chattanooga yarncrafters page # 7 set-in sleeve worked flat the scoop collar like the raglan crew neck is picked up and worked in the round at the end as with many full-scale sweaters this pattern uses a three-needle bind off to create a firm seam at the shoulders for structure and strength you may choose to use kitchener stitch grafting instead for a flatter join sweater flight 1 by ouisi hamilton for chattanooga yarncrafters page # 8 set-in sleeve body make 2 co 28 sts row 1 k1 k1 p1 to last st k1 row 2 p1 k1
